title: "Installation issue: openblas: default blas/lapack 'openblas' can't build on RHEL6 with gcc@7.2.0 built by Spack

labels.name: snl-atdm
labels.description: Issues for SNL ATDM usage of spack

body:
**snl-atdm-issue**

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ ./atdm-spack/spack/bin/spack install openblas %gcc@7.2.0
```

with build errors starting with:

```
==> Installing openblas
==> Searching for binary cache of openblas
==> Finding buildcaches in /ascldap/users/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/atdm-spack-tarball-mirror/build_cache
==> No binary for openblas found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/cache/openblas/openblas-0.3.5.tar.gz
==> Staging archive: /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/stage/openblas-0.3.5-ase7rloe2w5cvr7egf4fglyx5kw2egrl/v0.3.5.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/stage/openblas-0.3.5-ase7rloe2w5cvr7egf4fglyx5kw2egrl
==> No patches needed for openblas
==> Building openblas [MakefilePackage]
==> Executing phase: 'edit'
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 2:
    'make' '-j32' 'CC=/home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc' 'FC=/home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gfortran' 'MAKE_NB_JOBS=0' 'USE_OPENMP=0' 'USE_THREAD=0' 'libs' 'netlib' 'shared'

577 errors found in build log:
     1348    /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O2 -DMAX_STACK_ALLOC=2048 -Wall -m64 -DF_INTERFACE_GFORT -fPIC -DNO_AVX512 -DNO_WARMUP -DMAX_CPU_NUMBER=32 -DMAX_PARALLEL_NUMBER=1 
             -DVERSION=\"0.3.5\" -mavx2 -DASMNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LN -DASMFNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LN_ -DNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LN_ -DCNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LN -DCHAR_NAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_LN_\" -DCHAR_CNAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_LN\" -D
             NO_AFFINITY -I.. -DDOUBLE  -UCOMPLEX -c -DTRMMKERNEL -DDOUBLE -UCOMPLEX -DLEFT -UTRANSA ../kernel/x86_64/dtrmm_kernel_4x8_haswell.c -o dtrmm_kernel_LN.o
     1349    /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O2 -DMAX_STACK_ALLOC=2048 -Wall -m64 -DF_INTERFACE_GFORT -fPIC -DNO_AVX512 -DNO_WARMUP -DMAX_CPU_NUMBER=32 -DMAX_PARALLEL_NUMBER=1 
             -DVERSION=\"0.3.5\" -mavx2 -DASMNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LT -DASMFNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LT_ -DNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LT_ -DCNAME=dtrmm_kernel_LT -DCHAR_NAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_LT_\" -DCHAR_CNAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_LT\" -D
             NO_AFFINITY -I.. -DDOUBLE  -UCOMPLEX -c -DTRMMKERNEL -DDOUBLE -UCOMPLEX -DLEFT -DTRANSA ../kernel/x86_64/dtrmm_kernel_4x8_haswell.c -o dtrmm_kernel_LT.o
     1350    /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O2 -DMAX_STACK_ALLOC=2048 -Wall -m64 -DF_INTERFACE_GFORT -fPIC -DNO_AVX512 -DNO_WARMUP -DMAX_CPU_NUMBER=32 -DMAX_PARALLEL_NUMBER=1 
             -DVERSION=\"0.3.5\" -mavx2 -DASMNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RN -DASMFNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RN_ -DNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RN_ -DCNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RN -DCHAR_NAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_RN_\" -DCHAR_CNAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_RN\" -D
             NO_AFFINITY -I.. -DDOUBLE  -UCOMPLEX -c -DTRMMKERNEL -DDOUBLE -UCOMPLEX -ULEFT -UTRANSA ../kernel/x86_64/dtrmm_kernel_4x8_haswell.c -o dtrmm_kernel_RN.o
     1351    /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O2 -DMAX_STACK_ALLOC=2048 -Wall -m64 -DF_INTERFACE_GFORT -fPIC -DNO_AVX512 -DNO_WARMUP -DMAX_CPU_NUMBER=32 -DMAX_PARALLEL_NUMBER=1 
             -DVERSION=\"0.3.5\" -mavx2 -DASMNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RT -DASMFNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RT_ -DNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RT_ -DCNAME=dtrmm_kernel_RT -DCHAR_NAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_RT_\" -DCHAR_CNAME=\"dtrmm_kernel_RT\" -D
             NO_AFFINITY -I.. -DDOUBLE  -UCOMPLEX -c -DTRMMKERNEL -DDOUBLE -UCOMPLEX -ULEFT -DTRANSA ../kernel/x86_64/dtrmm_kernel_4x8_haswell.c -o dtrmm_kernel_RT.o
     1352    /home/rabartl/Spack.base3/atdm-spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -c -O2 -DMAX_STACK_ALLOC=2048 -Wall -m64 -DF_INTERFACE_GFORT -fPIC -DNO_AVX512 -DNO_WARMUP -DMAX_CPU_NUMBER=32 -DMAX_PARALLEL_NUMBER
             =1 -DVERSION=\"0.3.5\" -mavx2 -DASMNAME=dtrsm_kernel_LN -DASMFNAME=dtrsm_kernel_LN_ -DNAME=dtrsm_kernel_LN_ -DCNAME=dtrsm_kernel_LN -DCHAR_NAME=\"dtrsm_kernel_LN_\" -DCHAR_CNAME=\"dtrsm_kernel_LN\"
              -DNO_AFFINITY -I.. -DDOUBLE  -UCOMPLEX -DTRSMKERNEL -UCOMPLEX -DDOUBLE -DUPPER -DLN -UCONJ ../kernel/x86_64/../generic/trsm_kernel_LN.c -o dtrsm_kernel_LN.o
     1353    ../kernel/x86_64/dgemm_kernel_4x8_haswell.S: Assembler messages:
  >> 1354    ../kernel/x86_64/dgemm_kernel_4x8_haswell.S:1759: Error: no such instruction: `vpermpd $ 0xb1,%ymm0,%ymm0'
  >> 1355    ../kernel/x86_64/dgemm_kernel_4x8_haswell.S:1759: Error: no such instruction: `vpermpd $ 0x1b,%ymm0,%ymm0'
```

The STDOUT from spack is given in:

* [spack.install.openblas.gcc-7.2.0.rhel6..out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3458812/spack.install.openblas.gcc-7.2.0.rhel6.out.txt)

The the build log file:

```
atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/stage/openblas-0.3.5-ase7rloe2w5cvr7egf4fglyx5kw2egrl/OpenBLAS-0.3.5/spack-build.out
```

is:

* [OpenBLAS-0.3.5-spack-build.out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3458814/OpenBLAS-0.3.5-spack-build.out.txt)

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
 $ uname -a
Linux crf450.srn.sandia.gov 2.6.32-696.30.1.el6.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri May 18 11:50:44 EDT 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Red Hat Enterprise Linux Workstation release 6.9 (Santiago)
``` 

Here are the compilers (where gcc@7.2.0 was built by spack itself with gcc@4.4.7 on the system).

* [compilers.yaml.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/3458813/compilers.yaml.txt)

### Additional information

Sometimes the issue benefits from additional details. In these cases there are
a few things we can suggest doing. First of all, you can post the full output of:

```console
./atdm-spack/spack/bin/spack spec --install-status openblas %gcc@7.2.0
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   openblas%gcc@7.2.0

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: String contains no specs: 
```

to show people whether Spack installed a faulty software or if it was not able to
build it at all.
